# spectrocloud_brownfield_cluster_registration (Resource)

Register an existing Kubernetes cluster (brownfield) with Spectro Cloud. This resource creates a cluster registration and provides the import link and manifest URL needed to complete the cluster import process.



<!-- schema generated by tfplugindocs -->
## Schema

### Required

- `cloud_type` (String) The cloud type of the cluster. Supported values: `aws`, `eksa`, `azure`, `gcp`, `vsphere`, `openshift`, `generic`.
- `name` (String) The name of the cluster to be registered.

### Optional

- `container_mount_path` (String) Location to mount Proxy CA cert inside container. This is the file path inside the container where the Proxy CA certificate will be mounted.
- `context` (String) The context for the cluster registration. Allowed values are `project` or `tenant`. Defaults to `project`.If  the `project` context is specified, the project name will sourced from the provider configuration parameter [`project_name`](https://registry.terraform.io/providers/spectrocloud/spectrocloud/latest/docs#schema).
- `delete_cluster` (Boolean) Whether to delete the cluster when the resource is destroyed. If `true`, the cluster will be deleted. If `false`, only the Terraform resource will be removed but the cluster will remain in Spectro Cloud. Defaults to `false`.
- `host_path` (String) Location for Proxy CA cert on host nodes. This is the file path on the host where the Proxy CA certificate is stored.
- `import_mode` (String) The import mode for the cluster. Allowed values are `read_only` (imports cluster with read-only permissions) or `full` (imports cluster with full permissions). Defaults to `full`.
- `no_proxy` (String) Location to mount Proxy CA cert inside container. This field is an supports for vsphere and openshift clusters.
- `proxy` (String) Location to mount Proxy CA cert inside container.This field is an supports for vsphere and openshift clusters
- `timeouts` (Block, Optional) (see [below for nested schema](#nestedblock--timeouts))

### Read-Only

- `id` (String) The ID of this resource.
- `kubectl_command` (String) The kubectl command to import the cluster. Format: `kubectl apply -f <manifest_url>`.
- `manifest_url` (String) The URL of the import manifest. This is the actual manifest URL extracted from the kubectl_command.
- `status` (String) The current operational state of the cluster. Possible values include: `Pending`, `Provisioning`, `Running`, `Deleting`, `Deleted`, `Error`, `Importing`.

<a id="nestedblock--timeouts"></a>
### Nested Schema for `timeouts`

Optional:

- `create` (String)
- `delete` (String)
- `read` (String)
- `update` (String)
